el:string.el:english: Story by John Bunyan

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: I your dear friend am in myself undone, by reason of a Burden that lieth hard upon me.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: Do you see yonder Wicket Gate?

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: They drew nigh to a very miry Slough. The name of the Slough was Despond.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: Knock, and it shall be opened unto you.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: His Burden loosed from off his shoulders, and fell from his back, and began to tumble, and so continued to do, till it came to the mouth of the Sepulchre, where it fell in, and I saw it no more.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: They came to the foot of the hill Difficulty.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: There was a very stately palace before him, the name of which was Beautiful.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: He had gone but a little way, before he espied a foul Fiend coming over the field to meet him.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: At the end of this Valley was another, called, The Valley of the Shadow Of Death.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: He saw Faithful before him on his Journey.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: As they went on, Faithful, as he chanced to look to one side, saw a man whose name was Talkative.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: They presently saw a Town before them, and the name of that Town is Vanity.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: Christian went not forth alone; for there was one whose name was Hopeful who joined himself unto him.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: There was on the Left Hand of the road a Meadow, and a Stile to go over into it, and that meadow is called By-Path-Meadow.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: Now there was, not far from the place where they lay, a castle, called Doubting-Castle, the owner of which was Giant Despair.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: They went then till they came to the Delectable Mountains.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: Beware of the Flatterer.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan - exact quote is 'Follow me, said the man, it is thither that I am going' - a couple of words have been changed to make sense out of context.

el:string.el:english: Follow me, said the Flatterer, it is to the Coelestial City that I am going.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: They came into a certain Country, whose air naturally tended to make one drowzy.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: The Pilgrims were got over the Enchanted ground, and entering into the Country of Beulah.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: There was then in that place one Vain-Hope, a ferryman, that with his boat helped him over.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: At the sight therefore of this River, the Pilgrims were much astounded, but the men that went with them, said, You must go through, or you cannot come at the Gate.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan.

el:string.el:english: I looked in after them; and behold the City shone like the Sun.

el:english.el:comment: Quote from 'The Pilgrim's Progress' by John Bunyan - quote taken from the section of the Shepherds in the Delectable Mountains

el:string.el:english: They also thought they heard there a rumbling noise, as of fire, and a Cry of some tormented, and that they smelt the scent of Brimstone.
